definition: Ramadan (loanword)
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
red/pellet/powder/cinnabar

sentences.english: Ramadan would spend summers there, doting on the locals, he adds.
sentences.chinese: 他补充说，拉马丹将有花，夏季，当地人溺爱。

sentences.english: Muslims around the world are marking the start of Islam's holy month of Ramadan.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的穆斯林纪念伊斯兰神圣的拉马丹斋月开始。

definition: Abdullah (name)
Ahmed (name)
Hosni Mubarak (1928-), former Egyptian President and military commander
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Moussavi, Mir Hussein (1941-), candidate in Iran's disputed 2009 elections
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Massoud (name)/Ahmed Shah Massoud (1953-2001), Tajik Afghan engineer, military man and anti-Taleban leader
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
Sistani (name of a prominent Iraqi Ayatollah)
Fatah, Palestinian organization
Rice (name)/Condoleezza Rice (1954-) US Secretary of State 2005-2009
ayatollah (religious leader in Shia Islam)
Sadr (name)/Moqtada Sadr (c. 1973-), Iraqi Shia clergyman and militia leader
